p: The mock-vaccinated animals had no detectable virus neutralizing antibody levels post-inoculation. Virus neutralizing titres post-challenge were higher in the vaccinated group than in the mock-vaccinated group by 6 dpc ( Figure 9A). Rift Valley fever virus neutralizing antibodies were present in three of the five calves ( Figure 9B) after vaccination, which increased significantly after challenge by 6 dpc.
